  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractTimeDependentNegotiationParty
    Boulware/Conceder tactics, by Tim Baarslag, adapted from [1].
    AcceptingNegotiationParty
    Most basic voting agent implementation I could think of: this agent accepts any offer.
    Annealer
    Implementation of a party that uses simulated annealing strategy to get to an agreement.

    ConcederNegotiationParty

    Ask user to enter bid details.

    EnterBidDialogExtended
    This dialog works based on the Evaluators and therefore only can be used with AdditiveUtilitySpace.
    EnterBidDialogOfferForVoting  
    EnumeratorParty
    Debug class for enumerating all offers to a file
    FeedbackHillClimber
    Hill climber implementation for the mediator protocol with feedback.
    HillClimber
    Implementation of a party that uses hill climbing strategy to get to an agreement.
    HillClimberMajorityVoting
    Implementation of a party that uses hill climbing strategy to get to an agreement.
    MediatorHumanNegotiationParty
    modified version of W.Pasman's modified version of Dmytro's UIAgent
    NegotiationEndingParty
    Agent that always ends the nego as quick as possible, only placing a random bid if it starts.
    NonDeterministicConcederNegotiationParty  
    RandomCounterOfferNegotiationParty
    Basic voting implementation: this agent accepts and rejects offers with a 50% chance.
    RandomFiftyFiftyNegotiationParty
    Basic voting implementation: this agent accepts and rejects offers with a 50% chance.
    RandomMajorityVoting
    Random agent suited for AlternatingOfferMajorityVotingProtocol

    This party should be run with MediatorProtocol
    RandomParty
    Copies of the random party , needed for assignment to have 2 random agents in tournament.
    RandomParty2
    Copies of the random party , needed for assignment to have 2 random agents in tournament.
